Zend_Uri  
Zend_Uri  
No 
No 

Description

HTTP(S) URI handler

Methods

__construct, _parseUri, addReplaceQueryParameters, fromString, getFragment, getHost, getPassword, getPath, getPort, getQuery, getQueryAsArray, getUri, getUsername, removeQueryParameters, setFragment, setHost, setPassword, setPath, setPort, setQuery, setUsername, valid, validateFragment, validateHost, validatePassword, validatePath, validatePort, validateQuery, validateUsername,

__construct( string   $scheme, string   $schemeSpecific, ) : n/a

Description

Constructor accepts a string $scheme (e.g., http, https) and a scheme-specific part of the URI (e.g., example.com/path/to/resource?query=param#fragment)

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$scheme string | The scheme of the URI
$schemeSpecific string | The scheme-specific part of the URI

Return value

Type Description
n/a n/a

Tags

Name Description
throws Zend_Uri_Exception When the URI is not valid

_parseUri( string   $schemeSpecific, ) : void

Description

Parse the scheme-specific portion of the URI and place its parts into instance variables.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$schemeSpecific string | The scheme-specific portion to parse

Return value

Type Description
void

Tags

Name Description
throws Zend_Uri_Exception When scheme-specific decoposition fails
throws Zend_Uri_Exception When authority decomposition fails

addReplaceQueryParameters( array   $queryParams, ) : string

Description

Add or replace params in the query string for the current URI, and return the old query.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$queryParams array |

Return value

Type Description
string Old query string

fromString( string   $uri, ) : Zend_Uri_Http

Description

Creates a Zend_Uri_Http from the given string

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$uri string | String to create URI from, must start with 'http://' or 'https://'

Return value

Type Description
Zend_Uri_Http

Tags

Name Description
throws InvalidArgumentException When the given $uri is not a string or does not start with http:// or https://
throws Zend_Uri_Exception When the given $uri is invalid

getFragment( ) : string|false

Description

Returns the fragment portion of the URL (after #), or FALSE if none.

Return value

Type Description
string|false

Description

Returns the domain or host IP portion of the URL, or FALSE if none.

Return value

Type Description
string

Description

Returns the password portion of the URL, or FALSE if none.

Return value

Description

Returns the path and filename portion of the URL.

Return value

Type Description
string

getPort( ) : string

Description

Returns the TCP port, or FALSE if none.

Return value

Type Description
string

getQuery( ) : string

Description

Returns the query portion of the URL (after ?), or FALSE if none.

Return value

Type Description
string

getQueryAsArray( ) : array

Description

Returns the query portion of the URL (after ?) as a key-value-array. If the query is empty an empty array is returned

Return value

Type Description
array

getUri( ) : string

Description

Returns a URI based on current values of the instance variables. If any part of the URI does not pass validation, then an exception is thrown.

Return value

Type Description
string

Tags

Name Description
throws Zend_Uri_Exception When one or more parts of the URI are invalid

getUsername( ) : string

Description

Returns the username portion of the URL, or FALSE if none.

Return value

Type Description
string

Return value

valid( ) : boolean

Description

Validate the current URI from the instance variables. Returns true if and only if all parts pass validation.

Return value

Type Description
boolean

validateFragment( string   $fragment = null, ) : boolean

Description

Returns true if and only if the fragment passes validation. If no fragment is passed, then the fragment contained in the instance variable is used.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$fragment string | Fragment of an URI null

Return value

Type Description
boolean

Tags

Name Description
throws Zend_Uri_Exception When fragment validation fails
link http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2396.html

validateHost( string   $host = null, ) : boolean

Description

Returns true if and only if the host string passes validation. If no host is passed, then the host contained in the instance variable is used.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$host string | The HTTP host null

Return value

Type Description
boolean

Tags

Name Description
uses Zend_Filter

validatePort( string   $port = null, ) : boolean

Description

Returns true if and only if the TCP port string passes validation. If no port is passed, then the port contained in the instance variable is used.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$port string | The HTTP port null

Return value

Type Description
boolean

validateQuery( string   $query = null, ) : boolean

Description

Returns true if and only if the query string passes validation. If no query is passed, then the query string contained in the instance variable is used.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$query string | The query to validate null

Return value

Type Description
boolean

Tags

Name Description
throws Zend_Uri_Exception When query validation fails
